data.title: The 95+ Best Movies With Guy in the Title
data.meta_description: The 95+ Best Movies With Guy in the Title, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days, Little Mad Guy, A Guy Thing
data.text:
How many movies with guy in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with guy in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with guy in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with guy in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with guy in the title include The Cable Guy, How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days, and The New Guy, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the guy movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Released : 2003

Directed by : Donald Petrie

In this witty romantic comedy, a writer covering dating mistakes finds herself betting she can drive her new beau away in just ten days. The snappy banter and hilarious mix-ups make for a delightful viewing experience. Audiences will find themselves rooting for both sides of the bet as the couple navigates their rocky road to love.

2

Little Mad Guy

Little Mad Guy is a wildly hilarious Taiwanese martial arts comedy from 1982 that thrills with its wacky humor and kinetic energy. This movie delightfully discounts seriousness, steering its plot towards the ridiculous, while still delivering fistfuls of combat spectacle as the underdog protagonist hones his kung-fu skills to take down fraudsters.

Jason Lee, Julia Stiles, Selma Blair

Released : 2003

Directed by : Chris Koch

When it comes to love triangles, this romantic comedy is a cut above the rest. After waking up next to a mysterious woman after his bachelor party, the groom-to-be must tiptoe around his fianc√©e while trying to figure out his life. It's impossible not to root for the hilarious characters as they navigate the chaotic world of heartache and miscommunication.

Jim Carrey, Matthew Broderick, Leslie Mann

Released : 1996

Directed by : Ben Stiller

This dark comedy follows a lonely cable guy as he worms his way into the life of an unsuspecting customer for friendship's sake. The rollercoaster of misguided attachment serves up belly laughs and spine-chilling moments in equal measure. Bolstered by a standout performance from its lead, this twisted tale will keep viewers entertained throughout.

DJ Qualls, Eliza Dushku, Zooey Deschanel

Released : 2002

Directed by : Ed Decter

Embracing the motto "new school, new you," this charming teen comedy follows an awkward teenager who decides to reinvent himself after being given a second chance at popularity. Juggling friends, romance, and his reputation, the protagonist learns valuable lessons about identity and self-esteem. With an endearing cast, this movie offers heartfelt laughs and feel-good moments.

6

Mr. Nice Guy

Jan Smithers, Clark Johnson, Mike MacDonald

Released : 1987

Directed by : Henry Wolfond

This '80s cult classic tells the story of a lovable but clumsy everyman caught up in a high-stakes drug deal. Misadventures ensue as our protagonist unwittingly survives an onslaught of freak accidents. This comedy of errors will leave audiences in stitches as they witness the good fortune of Mr. Nice Guy.
